tasks.title: Parse properties.json
tasks.details: Read and parse `properties.json`, extracting the package namespace, Minecraft version, entrypoints, and scoreboard objectives. Ensure that the pack_format is correctly inferred from the Minecraft version or set a default if unknown.
tasks.testStrategy: Validate the parsing by comparing the loaded properties with expected values.

tasks.title: Initialize Variables Model
tasks.description: Design and implement the variable model for `int` and `var` types.
tasks.details: Create data structures to represent variables, ensuring that operations on `int` can only be performed by converting them to `var`, and vice versa. Implement conversion functions like `toInt` and `toVar`.
tasks.testStrategy: Verify the variable model with simple operations such as adding two `int`s or converting a `var` to an `int`.

tasks.title: Implement Coordinate System
tasks.description: Define and implement the coordinate system using `Position` structures.
tasks.details: Create a `Position` class that represents the (x, y, z) coordinates. Provide methods to create positions from entities or explicit coordinates.
tasks.testStrategy: Validate the position system with examples of creating and manipulating positions.

tasks.title: Parse Source Code
tasks.description: Implement parsing logic to handle `.oort` source code.
tasks.details: Read and parse the `.oort` files, identifying statements like declarations, assignments, conditions, loops, and imports. Ensure that identifiers are resolved correctly within their scopes.
tasks.testStrategy: Validate the parsing with simple examples of valid and invalid syntax.

tasks.title: Scope and Name Resolution
tasks.description: Implement scope management and name resolution to handle conflicts within variable declarations.
tasks.details: Ensure that variables, functions, macros, and imports are resolved correctly. Handle conflicts by using unique identifiers or namespaces.
tasks.testStrategy: Validate the scope and name resolution with examples of multiple variable declarations and conflicting names.

tasks.title: Macro Processing
tasks.description: Implement macro processing to convert Oort macros into Minecraft function macros.
tasks.details: Create functions that translate Oort macro calls into Minecraft command syntax. Store the generated Minecraft commands in a suitable format for later output.
tasks.testStrategy: Validate the macro processing by comparing generated commands with expected outputs.

tasks.title: Execute Statement Flattening
tasks.description: Implement logic to flatten execute statements into a single block.
tasks.details: Modify the structure of execute statements by flattening them into a single block, ensuring that modifiers are reordered according to Minecraft rules. Handle nested executes properly by merging them into one.
tasks.testStrategy: Validate the execution statement flattening with examples of nested and combined execute statements.

tasks.title: Int/Var Backend Determination
tasks.description: Decide the best backend representation for `int` and `var` types based on the generated IR.
tasks.details: Based on the intermediate representation (IR), determine whether to output `int` values directly or use a storage-based approach. This decision affects how variables are managed during execution.
tasks.testStrategy: Validate the backend determination by comparing the output with expected results for different variable types.

tasks.title: IR Generation
tasks.description: Generate an intermediate representation (IR) from the parsed source code.
tasks.details: Create a graph-based representation of the program, representing statements and their dependencies. Ensure that the IR accurately reflects the original source code structure.
tasks.testStrategy: Validate the IR generation by comparing the generated IR with expected outputs for simple examples.

tasks.title: Minecraft Function and Tag Generation
tasks.description: Implement logic to generate Minecraft function files and tags based on the generated IR.
tasks.details: Translate the intermediate representation into Minecraft commands and tags. Ensure that the generated files are correctly structured and have all necessary metadata like pack.mcmeta.
tasks.testStrategy: Validate the Minecraft function and tag generation by comparing the output with expected outputs for simple examples.
